current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Thursday, the third day of January, two thousand and thirteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text:
To authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the
		  Secretary of the Army to reconsider decisions to inter or honor the memory of a
		  person in a national cemetery, and for other purposes.

role.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Alicia Dawn Koehl Respect for
			 National Cemeteries Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Alicia Dawn Koehl Respect for National Cemeteries Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text: Authority to reconsider decisions of Secretary of Veterans Affairs or Secretary of the Army to inter the remains or honor the memory of a person in a national cemetery

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended—

text.#text: by redesignating subsection (d) as subsection (f); and
by inserting after subsection (c) the following new subsections:
In a case described in subsection (e), the appropriate Federal official may reconsider a decision to—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or in Arlington National Cemetery; or

text.#text: inter the remains of a person in a cemetery in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (described in
) or in such an area in Arlington National Cemetery (described in

text.#text: honor the memory of a person in a memorial area in a cemetery in the

In a case described in subsection (e)(1)(A), the appropriate Federal official shall provide notice to the deceased person’s next of kin or other person authorized to arrange burial or memorialization of the deceased person of the decision of the appropriate Federal official to disinter the remains of the deceased person or to remove a memorial headstone or marker memorializing the deceased person.

In a case described in subsection (e)(1)(B), if the appropriate Federal official finds, based upon a showing of clear and convincing evidence and after an opportunity for a hearing in a manner prescribed by the appropriate Federal official, that the person had committed a Federal capital crime or a State capital crime but had not been convicted of such crime by reason of such person not being available for trial due to death or flight to avoid prosecution, the appropriate Federal official shall provide notice to the deceased person’s next of kin or other person authorized to arrange burial or memorialization of the deceased person of the decision of the appropriate Federal official to disinter the remains of the deceased person or to remove a memorial headstone or marker memorializing the deceased person.
Notice under subparagraph (A) shall be provided by the appropriate Federal official as follows:
By the Secretary in accordance with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in accordance with such regulations as the
shall prescribe for purposes of this subsection.

text.#text: By the

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the next of kin or other person authorized to arrange burial or memorialization of the deceased person shall be allowed a period of 60 days from the date of the notice required by paragraph (2) to file a notice of disagreement with the Federal official that provided the notice.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and shall initiate appellate review in accordance with the provisions of

shall prescribe for purposes of this subsection.

When the decision of the appropriate Federal official to disinter the remains or remove a memorial headstone or marker of the deceased person becomes final either by failure to appeal the decision in accordance with paragraph (3)(A) or by final disposition of the appeal pursuant to paragraph (3)(B), the appropriate Federal official may take any of the following actions:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or in Arlington National Cemetery and provide for the reburial or other appropriate disposition of the disinterred remains in a place other than a cemetery in the
or in Arlington National Cemetery.

text.#text: Disinter the remains of the person from the cemetery in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or in Arlington National Cemetery any memorial headstone or marker placed to honor the memory of the person.

A case described in this subsection is a case in which the appropriate federal official receives—
written notice of a conviction referred to in subsection (b)(1), (b)(2), or (b)(4) of  a person described in paragraph (2); or

information that a person described in paragraph (2) may have committed a Federal capital crime or a State capital crime but was not convicted of such crime by reason of such person not being available for trial due to death or flight to avoid prosecution.
A person described in this paragraph is a person—

text.#text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to any interment or memorialization conducted by the

header.#text:
Disinterment of
			 remains of Michael LaShawn Anderson from Fort Custer National Cemetery

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall disinter the
			 remains of Michael LaShawn Anderson from Fort Custer National Cemetery.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—

text.#text: The

notify the
			 next-of-kin of record for Michael LaShawn Anderson of the impending
			 disinterment of his remains; and

upon
			 disinterment, relinquish the remains to the next-of-kin of record for Michael
			 LaShawn Anderson or, if the next-of-kin of record for Michael LaShawn Anderson
			 is unavailable, arrange for an appropriate disposition of the remains.
